page.title: 02Religious Life in Bedlington
page.content:
At the centre of religious life in Bedlington is St Cuthbert's Church. Its origins are to be found in the Anglo-Saxon times but much of the church has distinctive Norman features. The present incumbent (Rev Keith Ward) has seen many changes over his 20 years as vicar - women ministers, modern music and shorter services. Funding is a major problem. Pounds rather than pence are needed in the collection tray especially as the church contributes to diocesan funds. People have to be coaxed into the church. The grave yard allows a glimpse of Bedlington's past. A stone (Watson's Wake) is to be found on the tower and is dedicated to Cuthbert Watson a local personality who died
while sleeping on the tower in l669.
